message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper discusses the design of distributed storage systems, which involves coding theory and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the challenges of designing distributed storage systems, which involves distributed systems and algorithms, making cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DC (Databases) likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the construction of codes, which involves coding theory and algebraic geometry, making cs.SI (Systems and Control) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the efficiency and performance of the constructed codes, which involves networking and communication, making cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) a possible sub-category.
